header.rec_loc: ANON’s home, Horrabridge, Nr Yelverton, Devon
header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Reminiscing and anecdote telling about family members and neighbours A psychological experiment ANON is participating in Driverless cars Air travel and air safety Driving Food and drink – rice krispy cakes Supermarkets Scan As You Go at supermarkets Food shopping Insurance and new build houses ANON’s old house and new one Google’s tax deal with HMRC Bicycles Languages Travel Garden and gardening
header.activity: Family talking about other family members and neighbours

speaker.fls: Spanish -- level unspecified; Japanese -- level unspecified

grandpa and I have taken part in a psychological experiment for
we're not allowed to know the results
that's a bit of a problem
yes I'm involved in this experiment erm for a new form of CBT treatment they're trialling

some programme on a phone they put lent me a smartphone for the weekend we have to pro for the week actually have to programme in five or they programmed in five activities you want to enjoy over the week it can be anything you want but it has to be alone and it's not allowed to be watching TV or sleeping

or getting drunk anything other than that is fine so they make you list them they did that yesterday with me I then put in a time that you want to do it and then it beeps at you and tells you when to go and do it and five like fifteen minutes before tells you go and get your boots or whatever er and then it asks you how happy you are and then afterwards you go and do the activity

and then it asks you again how you feel cos they're saying er you're anticipation of events is a large part of enjoying them so the more specific you are about scheduling events you're going to enjoy by yourself and this is key then the more likely you are to be happy overall and most of us are very bad at that we schedule appointments like the doctor we schedule going to work schedule meeting other people like meeting you today we had a time we're very bad at scheduling time by ourselves where we're going to do something we enjoy
and pepe well it's probably true for everybody and for people who are depressed that is a key part of it the more you anticipate it the
just the the very anticipation is part of it so it's not just
alright I think I'll go and take a walk now it's actually the build-up it's quite interesting

and then they're looking at erm how we perceive the event while we're doing it so if you're a happy person if you're reasonably satisfied then you just go and do the event and you'll probably enjoy it that's called savouring but for someone who's depressed they will have what they call dampening effects which means they'll go and they'll do their walk but the whole time they'll feel guilty that they should be doing something else or they'll think this is too good to last so they'll have all these negative thoughts while they're doing it which of course by default means you

yes you've ruined the whole experience anyway so the yeah part of prompt is it tells you you're meant to be feeling erm not feeling happy but they say to try and avoid these negative thoughts just stop it s CBT so they do that before you do the activity to remind you but then during it they don't do it cos that might be annoying sort of beeping at you the whole time yes it's quite interesting so I've got these five
activities in a week but they say if they did it
